abstract.para: Linux system roles are a set of &ansible; roles designed to automate and configure common components and services of the Linux operating system.

topic.para: Linux system roles are typically used with &ansible; playbooks. You define the desired state of your systems in an &ansible; playbook, specifying which roles to apply and with what parameters. &ansible; then connects to your Linux hosts and executes the tasks defined within the roles to bring your systems into the desired state.

The system roles are shipped in the ansible-linux-system-roles package on &productname; 16.0 systems. These roles can be run from any supported Ansible control node and do not require installation on managed nodes.
